intro: Puelia subsessilis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved puelia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family, characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that often display vibrant colors. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments, such as along riverbanks and in wetlands. Its leaves are narrow and sessile, contributing to its common name, while its flowering period usually occurs during the wet season. Puelia subsessilis is often found in shaded or semi-shaded areas, thriving in humid conditions.
